wikipedia_page.main: Richard G. Rodger, FRHistS, FAcSS, is a historian specialising in the business, urban and economic history of modern Britain. Formerly Professor of Urban History and Director of the Centre for Urban History at the University of Leicester, since 2007 he has been Professor of Economic and Social History at Edinburgh University.

response: * (ed. with Richard Rodger) The Victorian City. A Reader in British Urban History, 1820–1914 (London: Longman, 1993).
